Leaves: Alternate, finely twice-dissected, up to 2cm long, grey-greenish.
Flowers: Yellow button daisy-like, nearly globular flowerheads 5-8 mm across. Ray florets are absent.
FruitSeeds: Wedge-shaped, 1 mm long, ribbed and pimply, with tiny scales at the top.
Habitat: Salt lakes, disturbed sites, agricultural land.
DistinguishingFeatures: Differs from Calomba daisy (*Oncosiphon suffruticosum*) in having smaller leaves and fewer flowerheads, and from Lavender-cotton (*Santolina chamaecyparissus*) in being herbaceous.
